title: The Emblem Of Fire
opening: Lord Erik, Marquess of Laus, had been working with Bern against his allies of Lycia. This gave Roy further shock. Lycia, where Roy had grown up in, was no longer a safe place to be either. Heading for Ostia, Roy decided to move through the mountains, where people seldom want to avoid unnecessary trouble.

intro.speaker: Bandit
intro.line: Boss! Our boys just got back from scouting the village.

intro.speaker: Dory
intro.line: Then let's go get our tribute.

intro.speaker: Bandit
intro.line: But Boss, something's different today. There's an army stationed real close to us! They say it looks like the Lycian Army.

intro.speaker: Dory
intro.line: Lycia? Then there's nothing to worry about. They were almost wiped out by Bern. We can handle a few battered soldiers.

intro.speaker: Bandit
intro.line: You're right, boss!

intro.speaker: Boss
intro.line: They've probably got some valuables on them too! Still, don't get careless. Ready then? Let's mop up these losers, boys!

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: A villager is here to see you, Lord Roy. Hey, you, wait just a second...

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: Are you Lord Roy of House Pherae?

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Yes. How may I help you?

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: Milord, I beg you! Please, rid us of the bandits terrorizing our village!

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Bandits?

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: There's a group of bandits that made their base in the castle near the cliffs.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Where are the castle guards?

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: They fled once they heard that the Lycian Army was defeated by Bern... We villagers were left on our own. Our days are spent in fear of bandit attacks.

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: We have no one else we can ask. Please, help us!

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Lord Roy, we must keep our pace towards Ostia...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Yes, I know. But we can't simply ignore people in need of help!

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: You're joking!

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: You will help us?! Thank you! Please use the gate to the west. It'll take you right to the castle.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Thank you.

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: I'll arrange for the gate to be opened when you give the signal.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Merlinus! We're going to the castle to drive off the bandits!

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Sigh... Youthful energy. Where does it come from?

battle.speaker: Yoder
battle.line: Thank you, Dorothy. Please tell Brother Saul as well.

battle.speaker: Dorothy
battle.line: I will, Father Yoder.

battle.speaker: Dorothy
battle.line: But where did Saul run off to now? How am I supposed to guard him if he keeps disappearing?

battle.speaker: Girl
battle.line: Er... Brother Saul, I appreciate the offer, but not tonight...

battle.speaker: Saul
battle.line: Come now, don't be like that. We can sit by the fire in the dark of night as I soothe you with my calming sermons...

battle.speaker: Dorothy
battle.line: There you are! Saul!

battle.speaker: Saul
battle.line: Wonderful. Dorothy...

battle.speaker: Girl
battle.line: I'll take my leave now.

battle.speaker: Saul
battle.line: No, don't go! Oh my... Look what you've done now, Dorothy. That expression on your face scared her away.

battle.speaker: Dorothy
battle.line: This is my normal look! Saul, you can't try to woo every girl you meet.

battle.speaker: Saul
battle.line: You make it sound like a bad thing! I simply offer my helping hand to any poor souls in need.

battle.speaker: Dorothy
battle.line: Then why do you always offer to give your sermons at night?

battle.speaker: Saul
battle.line: ...Well, putting that aside... Did you have some good reason for interrupting my good work?

battle.speaker: Dorothy
battle.line: Oh, right. The Lycian Army is apparently somewhere around here.

battle.speaker: Saul
battle.line: Truly?! Is Princess Guinivere still with them?

battle.speaker: Dorothy
battle.line: Yes, if the reports from the St. Elimine Church are accurate.

battle.speaker: Saul
battle.line: Then we must make haste! Let us join them.

battle.speaker: Saul
battle.line: What's the matter, Dorothy?

battle.speaker: Dorothy
battle.line: You only want to join them because Princess Guinivere is said to be so beautiful.

battle.speaker: Saul
battle.line: Don't be ridiculous... Come now, hurry along.

battle.speaker: Dorothy
battle.line: Yes, let's go!

visit.speaker: Village
visit.line: Hold on. Before you go, take this lance with you. It was once wielded by a knight called Sir Gant. The stories say he bested many a foe with this lance!

visit.speaker: House
visit.line: If you can, try to occupy forts. That'll stop enemy reinforcements from showing up!

visit.speaker: House
visit.line: I was there when Araphen was taken... The wyvern riders of Bern were terrifying enough... But then a dragon engulfed the Lycian Army in flame... Oh Elimine, please tell me it was a dream...

visit.speaker: House
visit.line: This whole area is really perfect for bandits. It's no wonder they appeared. They can cross mountains and a bandit on a peak is a force to be reckoned with. Dreadful. Just dreadful...

boss.speaker: Dory
boss.line: No one's ever survived a blow from my axe! Hey, you. Wanna see why?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Lord Roy! A priest from the St. Elimine Church wants an audience with you...and Princess Guinivere!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: He knew that Princess Guinivere was with us?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Yes. I can't imagine how.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Me neither... I'll see him alone.

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: Roy, I will be fine. I wish to meet this priest.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Princess?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: Tensions between my brother and the church have worsened as of late. I do not believe they would attempt anything underhanded.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I see. Merlinus, allow this priest in.

end.speaker: Saul
end.line: Lord Roy, it is a pleasure to meet you at last. I am Saul, an acolyte of the St. Elimine Church.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Pleased to meet you.

end.speaker: Saul
end.line: Oh... And you must be Princess Guinivere! You are as beautiful as the rumors say!

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: Pardon me...?

end.speaker: Saul
end.line: Ahem... Forgive me. Your Highness, I wish to know the location of the Fire Emblem. You have it with you, do you not?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: How did you know that?!

end.speaker: Saul
end.line: Bern's head church tells us the Fire Emblem disappeared from the Shrine of Seals. And you also went missing at exactly the same time.

end.speaker: Saul
end.line: I was sent by the Church to confirm the truth. Why did you take the Fire Emblem?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: ...I wished to stop my brother.

end.speaker: Saul
end.line: Your brother... Zephiel, the king of Bern.

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: Yes.

end.speaker: Saul
end.line: Do you know what the Fire Emblem is used for?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: ...It's the key that awakens a sword that was used to slay the dragons long ago. That was what my father told me anyway. I am unsure how exactly the Fire Emblem or the sword work. My brother seemed to worry abut the Fire Emblem falling into enemy hands. ...Extraordinarily so.

end.speaker: Saul
end.line: So you took the Fire Emblem to make the king believe it fell into enemy hands? All in an attempt to stop his conquest?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: Yes...but the war continued anyway.

end.speaker: Saul
end.line: And what will you do now?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: ...Must I reveal my plan at this moment?

end.speaker: Saul
end.line: Ah, so Your Highness has a plan.

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: Yes. I have not given up hope of settling this war without further bloodshed.

end.speaker: Saul
end.line: I see. In that case, I will accompany you on your journey.

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: If Roy allows it.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I have no objections.

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: Thank you, Roy.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Of course, Princess.
